#Text=3. Description of the Hybrid Flow-Shop Scheduling Problem
#Text=In this section , HFSP is introduced , and its standard model is established .
#Text=A typical HFSP is shown in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=, there are S stages in total in the process of HFSP , and m 1 , m 2 , … , m S machines are included in each stage , respectively .
#Text=Every workpiece must be worked in all stages in a certain order .
#Text=In each stage , however , any one machine can be selected for each workpiece .
#Text=For instance , the sequence [ start , M 12 , M 24 , … , M S 3 , stop ] can be one of an order of a workpiece being machined .
#Text=In HFSP , several assumptions are usually made as follows :
#Text=first , once a workpiece starts to be worked , it cannot be interrupted ;
#Text=second , a machine can only process one workpiece at a time ;
#Text=third , a workpiece can only be processed on one machine at a time ;
#Text=fourth , workpieces can be machined on any machine at each stage ;
#Text=fifth , there is unlimited storage capacity between any two stages ( i.e. , a workpiece can wait for any time between the two processes ) .

#Text=HFSP is divided into the determined initial sequence HFSP and the non-determined initial sequence HFSP in this paper , according to whether the initial sequence of the workpiece is deterministic or not .

#Text=Knowing the processing time in each stage of the workpiece on each machine , the purpose of HFSP is to determine the distribution of each workpiece on the machines at each stage to minimize the maximum completion time for the former .
#Text=For the latter , the ordering of all workpieces is necessary to define additionally .
#Text=( = 1 , 2 , … , n ) indicates the workpieces needed to be worked , in which n is the total number of workpieces .
#Text=( = 1 , 2 , … , S ) is the number of machines in each stage .
#Text=is the machining time of the workpiece at stage , machine .
#Text=is the time cost on the way from stage to stage .
#Text=is the arrival time of workpiece at stage , machine .
#Text=Correspondingly , and indicate the starting and ending times of workpiece which is machined at stage , machine .
#Text=and reveal the time when the machine at stage starts to work and stops working .

#Text=The standard mathematical model of HFSP is as follows : ( 1 ) ( 2 ) where if workpiece is worked at stage , machine , else ( 3 ) ( 4 ) ( 5 ) ( 6 ) if workpiece is the first one machined at stage , machine and without interruption .
#Text=( 7 ) if workpiece is worked at stage , machine .
#Text=Equation ( 1 ) is the objective function , minimizing the maximum ending time of all workpieces in the last stage S.
#Text=Equation ( 2 ) ensures that there is only one workpiece at any machine in any stage .
#Text=Equation ( 3 ) clears the time limitation of arrival and start .
#Text=Equation ( 4 ) shows the relationship between the completion time and the start time of the process at the same stage .
#Text=Equation ( 5 ) calculates the arrival time on the next stage utilizing the end time of the previous stage .
#Text=Equations ( 6 ) and ( 7 ) reveal the time when the machine at stage starts to work and stops working .
